title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1707/84 of 19 June 1984 suspending the application in the sugar sector of certain provisions of Regulation (EEC) No 2730/79
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1707/84
of 19 June 1984
suspending the application in the sugar sector of certain provisions of Regulation (EEC) No 2730/79
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body: The application of Article 10 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 2730/79 is hereby suspended in the cases referred to in (b) of that paragraph in respect of exports of the products referred to in Article 1 (1) (a) of Regulation (EEC) No 1785/81.

With a view to a revision, if necessary, of Article 1, and without prejudice to Article 5 (1) (a) of Commission Regulation (EEC) No 787/83 (5), the Member States shall inform the Commission, by 4 p.m. on the day on which the application is made, of every application for an import licence for a quantity exceeding 50 tonnes of the products referred to in Article 1 other than applications for the licence referred to in Article 6 of Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2630/81 (6).

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply from 1 July 1984.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 19 June 1984.
For the Commission
Poul DALSAGER
Member of the Commission
